item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Self-pity is our worst enemy and if we yield to it, we can never do anything good in the world." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The best and most beautiful things in the world cannot be seen or even touched. They must be felt with the heart" -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "When one door of happiness closes, another opens; but often we look so long at the closed door that we do not see the one which has been opened for us." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, vision cleared, ambition inspired, and success achieved." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Although the world is full of suffering, it is full also of the overcoming of it." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "I long to accomplish a great and noble task, but it is my chief duty to accomplish small tasks as if they were great and noble." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "The most pathetic person in the world is some one who has sight but no vision." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Hellen Keller
item.description: "What I'm looking for is not out there, it is in me." -- Hellen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Science may have found a cure for most evils; but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all -- the apathy of human beings." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Helen Keller
item.description: "Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing." -- Helen Keller

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Life is for the living. Death is for the dead. Let life be like music. And death a note unsaid." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Hold fast to dreams, For if dreams die Life is a broken-winged bird, That cannot fly." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Langston Hughes
item.description: "Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby." -- Langston Hughes

item.title: Rosalin add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Your task is not to seek for love, but merely to seek and find all the barriers within yourself that you have built against it." -- Rumi
